intro: Memecylon pseudogaleatum, commonly known as the slender memecylon, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, oblong berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
